articles.title: How to Order Your Game
articles.summary: After you have put all the work into loading your images into your game and proofing them , you will want to order a copy of your game. Many designers want to order multiple copies of their game. Please order only one copy of your game and check it carefully for any errors, omissions, or changes that need to be made before ordering multiple copies of your game or publishing your game. This will save you time, money and stress down the road. -------------------------------------------------------

articles.summary: We want you to know that your intellectual property is protected when you use The Game Crafter. When you upload a game to The Game Crafter, you still retain all rights to the game. We do not assume your copyrights or trademarks. The Game Crafter is not mentioned in your game components unless you put it in there yourself. Absolutely! You will not be involved in the transaction, except for receiving a royalty payment approximately 30 days after the sale. articles.summary: The Game Crafter is a print on demand board game publisher. Our website allows anyone to create their own board game, card game, or custom playing cards. Game designers have a lot of flexibility and can build out their game with playing cards, game boards, tiles, game pieces, rules documents, and custom packaging. articles.title: Who is TGC for?
articles.summary: The reality is that most games will never sell 10,000 units. Unfortunately, traditional production runs require you to buy 5,000 - 20,000 units to make production cheap enough to be profitable. At The Game Crafter (TGC), even if your game only sells one copy, you'll have made a profit! Try to beat that by negotiating with publishers, distributors, retailers, and manufacturers. Even if you are an established game developer, making prototypes for play-testing can be time-consuming and costly. Some

articles.title: Can I buy some of the components of my game instead of having to buy the whole game?
articles.summary: Yes. The easiest thing to do would be to create a copy of your game, delete any pieces you don't need, then place an order for the copy. To create a copy of your game, click on "Games", click on "Edit" next to your game, then click on "Copy" in the Manage section.

articles.title: Can I make an adult-themed game?

articles.title: Custom Punchouts: Hinges
articles.summary: A hinge is a tie that is meant to bend rather than separate. Hinges can be used to create 3-dimensional objects .For parts that need to bend or have a hinge, use ties that are 0.07” wide with slits that are 0.5” long and 0.07” wide. Adding more ties will yield a stronger hinge. Hinges.ai For a cleaner look, hinges or bends may be made with a straight line rather than a 0.07” rectangle. However, this will yield a weaker hinge.

articles.title: Custom Punchouts: Screws & Dials
articles.summary: Screws come as two pieces that twist together to hold 2-3 layers of chipboard. A great way to utilize these features is by creating custom dials. To create a dial, begin by downloading the printing template of the desired slug size.

articles.title: Custom Punchouts: Standees
articles.summary: Standees are harder to make than you might think. The slot that hooks the two pieces together must be very precise for them to stay connected. The slot in the bottom of the upper piece must be the same height as the remaining area below the slit on the lower piece. For a snug fit, the slots are smaller at the innermost end than they are at the opening. Our chipboard is .065" thick, so the opening of the slot should also be .065" wide. The innermost end of the slot should be .055" wide.

articles.title: Game Mats
articles.summary: Mats are a great option for game designers who are looking for low-cost, custom-printed game components. Mats provide designers with plenty of flexibility and they are affordable because they're produced from cardstock. Mats use a 16pt cardstock that is slightly thicker than the cardstock used for our cards. All mats are printed double-sided in full color. articles.summary: When you enable linen texture on your game, all applicable items in your game from your cards to your box to your game board will get our professional linen texture. This finish is available with or without the UV coating (but the UV coating really makes it pop). **Note: Linen texture does not work well with dry erase markers, as the marker residue will get caught in the texture. If you wish for both sides of the bill to be oriented in the same direction in print, you will need to rotate either the front or the back image by 180 degrees, so that the images are oriented in opposite directions in the game editor.

articles.title: Shards
articles.summary: Shards are basically miniature mats. They're an inexpensive printable token that can be used to keep track of resources such as health, ammunition, or other counters. In war games, they can be used to represent units on the battlefield. Our shards are printed on two sides in full color and full bleed on 0.012-inch thick cardstock. *Please be sure to indicate the quantity of shards you wish to receive, as you will receive only as many as are indicated in the "Quantity" field next to each shard.*

articles.title: Stickers
articles.summary: Stickers are a printable item designed to be placed on game components by customers before playing the game. Right now we offer Custom Stickers , Dice Stickers , Meeple Stickers , Mint Tin Stickers , Pawn Stickers , and Token Stickers .

articles.title: Tiles
articles.summary: Tiles are the foundational element in many games, as they are used for the dynamic building of game boards. This enables them to keep the replayability of games strong. All of our tiles are printed double-sided in full color. *Please be sure to indicate the quantity of tiles you wish to receive, as you will receive only as many as are indicated in the "Quantity" field next to each tile.* Note: If a component only has a quantity of 1, that means we will ship you 1 copy of that image/component (ch

articles.title: UV Coating
articles.summary: UV coating is a special liquid that bonds to your game pieces via UV light. It protects your game from dirt, scratches, and moisture. It also makes your game pieces dry erase (for use with our dry erase markers ). You can add UV coating to your game for $.25 per component sheet. articles.summary: The 3D viewer allows you to see a 3D rendering of your game components. It also allows you to see what the printing will look like with varying degrees of drift. For boxes, the viewer allows you to see what the box will look like when open and closed. For folding game boards and mats, it allows you to see what the board/mat will look like when folded and unfolded. For dials, you can use the 3D viewer to see how the print will appear on the assembled dial wheels. For custom dice, you can use the

Most game design assets come in the form of sets so that you have almost everything you need to create a game. Most are sold under our standard commercial license that gives you the rights to do almost anything you want with the assets, except resell them yourself. This gives you the flexibility to use the images to build you

articles.title: Custom Acrylic Shapes
articles.summary: Board game designers can now create their own 100% custom acrylic game pieces! In the past we’ve allowed you to make custom punchouts, stickers, cards, and other printable components all to your exact specifications. For the first time we can now do that with plastic game pieces. You’ll start with a piece of 8 inch by 4 inch or 10.5 inch x 9 inch acrylic. The 8 x 4 comes in 2 thicknesses(1/4″ or 1/8″) and over a dozen colors.

articles.title: Custom Dice
articles.summary: The Game Crafter can manufacture several types of custom dice. They are produced on demand and can be ordered in any quantity. You can find more information about Dice Stickers and how to get them here. You can use the dice stickers with our blank dice . You can find more information about Custom Printed Dice and how to get them here.

articles.title: Custom Printed Meeples
articles.summary: You can design your own full color custom printed Meeples ! These are perfect for adding extra flair to any game. Plus, you can print front and back so you can determine directionality for your Meeples. Pricing is $0.50 per Meeple base, plus $0.75 per printed side. However, if you have 6 or more Meeples in your game, the cost drops to only $0.25 per printed side. And you can choose to print only 1 side if you like. To do so, you'll just upload full-color images like you would with any of our oth

articles.title: Custom Punchouts and Card Stock
articles.summary: With custom punchouts and cardstock , you can design your own shapes to be cut. You choose the size of the slug you want to use, and then create the artwork and the cut lines! For the first time, you can have truly bespoke game pieces in a print on demand game. All custom punchouts are printed and made of 60 point (0.07 inches) thick chipboard. All custom card stock items are printed and made of 12pt 320gsm black core card stock. The slug sizes for custom punchouts are 3.25" x 5.25" for small ,

articles.title: Custom Punchouts: Hinges
articles.summary: A hinge is a tie that is meant to bend rather than separate. Hinges can be used to create 3-dimensional objects .For parts that need to bend or have a hinge, use ties that are 0.07” wide with slits that are 0.5” long and 0.07” wide. Adding more ties will yield a stronger hinge. Hinges.ai For a cleaner look, hinges or bends may be made with a straight line rather than a 0.07” rectangle. However, this will yield a weaker hinge.

articles.title: Custom Punchouts: Screws & Dials
articles.summary: Screws come as two pieces that twist together to hold 2-3 layers of chipboard. A great way to utilize these features is by creating custom dials. To create a dial, begin by downloading the printing template of the desired slug size.

articles.title: Custom Punchouts: Spinners
articles.summary: Do you have a game idea that requires a randomizer with custom icons and a D6 just isn’t cutting it? Consider making a custom spinner! Previously, the only spinner available at the Game Crafter is an 8” mat made of cardstock. With the custom punchout option, spinners can now be made of sturdy chipboard, in many sizes and infinite shapes. Spinners come as two pieces that snap together. Our spinners are 2.73” long, making them a great size for a 3” spinner tile that can fit on the Small Punchout s

articles.title: Custom Punchouts: Standees
articles.summary: Standees are harder to make than you might think. The slot that hooks the two pieces together must be very precise for them to stay connected. The slot in the bottom of the upper piece must be the same height as the remaining area below the slit on the lower piece. For a snug fit, the slots are smaller at the innermost end than they are at the opening. Our chipboard is .065" thick, so the opening of the slot should also be .065" wide. The innermost end of the slot should be .055" wide.

Most printers, including ours, print with four colors: cyan, magenta, yellow, and black (CMYK). articles.title: Who is TGC for?
articles.summary: The reality is that most games will never sell 10,000 units. Unfortunately, traditional production runs require you to buy 5,000 - 20,000 units to make production cheap enough to be profitable. At The Game Crafter (TGC), even if your game only sells one copy, you'll have made a profit! Try to beat that by negotiating with publishers, distributors, retailers, and manufacturers.
